Opened pull request "[WIP] Add support for child insertion based on schema" (#676) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, the order in which items are inserted is very much dependent on hard coded values from a code generator. This change instead utilizes the information in the particle constraint that already exists on an item to determine where the child should be inserted.

Part of #492

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SectionProperties does not expose child elements as properties" (#620) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

In contrast to most other classes in the SDK, the [Wordprocessing SectionProperties](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/documentformat.openxml.wordprocessing.sectionproperties?view=openxml-2.8.1) does not expose the child elements as strongly-typed properties. This makes Wordprocessing sections even more difficult to use than they already are.

Looking at the documentation, the allowed child elements for the last section and the section in the paragraphs do allow exactly the same child elements, so that should not be the reason for not exposing these as properties.

**Information**

- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.8.1

**Observed**

There are no strongly-typed properties for the elements bidi, cols, docGrid etc. available.

**Expected**

Having strongly-typed properties for the elements bidi, cols, docGrid etc. available.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "cx:chartSpace is Missing" (#675) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**cx:chartSpace is Missing**

When trying to create a histogram chart (an example of an extended chart) in office the cx:chartSpace xml element is required. A C# class for this exists in an uncompiled test which is named `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office2016.Drawing.ChartDrawing.ChartSpace`. For some reason this class isn't included in the sdk.

**Information**

- .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.10

**Repro**

```csharp
DrawingsPart drawingsPart = ...;
var extendedChartPart = drawingsPart.AddNewPart<ExtendedChartPart>();

\\I want the below line to work, but the ChartSpace element doesn't exist. Also it would be nice to be able to call extendedChartPart.ChartSpace = rather than extendedChartPart.RootElement =
extendedChartPart.RootElement = new DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office2016.Drawing.ChartDrawing.ChartSpace();
``` 

**Observed**

It doesn't compile and there doesn't seem to be an easy workaround
